Review.Titre: I recently had a terrible experience with Rebtel…
Review.Contenu: I recently had a terrible experience with Rebtel, a company I previously used to send phone loads to my relatives in the Philippines and Mexico. Unfortunately, my identity was stolen and sold on the black web, which led me to cancel my cell phone number and switch to a new provider with a new number. One day, I needed to send a load to the Philippines and logged in to Rebtel to enter the code for recharging. However, the screen repeatedly indicated that the code was incorrect even after requesting a new one. In a panic, because my wife was on an emergency call in the Philippines and her phone was running out of load, I created a new account on Rebtel's website. Although the process appeared to be successful, the account was locked, and I was unable to send the emergency load. I tried to contact Rebtel via email, but it took days for them to respond, and their solution was unsatisfactory because they requested personal information that could compromise my identity. As a victim of identity theft, I was unwilling to disclose that type of sensitive information. Furthermore, Rebtel charged my credit card $1 US dollar, which I assumed was to confirm that the credit card was valid. Unfortunately, I was wrong, and my account was locked. I informed Rebtel that I was an existing customer and that I was recharging a phone registered in their system. I explained that I had created a new account with a different number and device because I could not log in to my original account. However, my new account was still locked, and Rebtel's support team was unhelpful. In my opinion, Rebtel needs to establish a foolproof system of checks and balances, such as two-step authentication, a code sent to the registered email, or Rebtel App approvals, to verify a person's identity. I don't think it's fair to treat customers like criminals just for doing business with them. Finally, I found another company in the Philippines that provided better prices than Rebtel. They charged only $8.70 US dollars for 1000 5G minutes, compared to Rebtel's $10.20 US dollars for 500 minutes. As a result, I decided to switch and say goodbye to Rebtel.

Rebtel failed to define what such numbers are, so I asked Rebtel how would I be able to identify such a number? No answer from Rebtel.Rebtel's customer service persisted in answering me in their corporate-speak about how they "understand it's frustrating to have to pay..." Ahem. In the afternoon of February 24, upon my pursuit, they responded saying they are still working on my case. Is it rare to use a local SIM card while travelling? Now they are asking for my personal call logs to verify that I really have made successful calls to that number so they can make a case to 'convice' their tech team to look into the issue. Review.Titre: I was excited to try Rebtel's service…
Review.Contenu: I was excited to try Rebtel's service for international calls, as I had heard good things about the company from friends and family. However, my experience with Rebtel was nothing short of a nightmare.After signing up for the service and purchasing a package, I eagerly awaited my local numbers so that I could start making calls to my loved ones. However, things quickly went downhill.Every time I tried to make a call, it took an excessively long time to connect. I found myself constantly redialing and waiting on hold, only to be told that the connection could not be established. It was incredibly frustrating, especially considering the high price I was paying for this service.I reached out to Rebtel's customer service multiple times, hoping for some assistance. However, the representatives were unable to resolve the issue and seemed to have little knowledge or understanding of the problems I was experiencing.After several weeks of struggling with Rebtel's service, I finally decided to switch to a different provider. It was a tough decision, as I had already invested a significant amount of money in Rebtel's package. However, I simply couldn't continue to deal with the constant issues and lack of support.I am extremely disappointed with my experience with Rebtel. Not only did their service fail to deliver the reliable connection I was expecting, but their customer support was completely inadequate. I would not recommend this company to anyone, as there are much better options available for international calls.

Review.Titre: Improper Accounting for Prepaid International Call Minutes
Review.Contenu: The prepaid minutes for my international calls keep disappearing mysteriously. A lot of times, when I attempt to place an international call via Rebtel, minutes will be deducted from the balance on the prepared minutes even though such call never went through. That is, no connection was successful via such a call. Furthermore, a lot of times when my call is successfully connected and the call get disconnected mid-communication, the minutes accounted for such a call will be higher than the exact time that elapsed during the actual call.If you are wondering if the service is that bad, why are you still using it? The quick answer is a monopoly and lack of competition. I place international calls via the Rebtel app to older relatives/family friends who reside in rural parts of developing countries and are not tech-savvy enough to utilize WhatsApp, FaceTime, and/or apps for making international calls except for Rebtel.So, in a way, I continue to use Rebtel to call such individuals because I am stuck with it.

I imagine I am representative of the average customer.

Well you charge almost 60 cents per minute for such calls as opposed to about 1 cent otherwise. If I could have heard the number of minutes upon dialing, I would have hung up. my Ooma service charged me only 3 cents for the 800 call.

When I called Swaziland it was almost as if I was calling from a landline within the country itself.*edit:* The line I called was Swaziland/eSwatini (as the country in Africa) . It is indeed GBP 7.00 for 30 minutes.

Review.Titre: I made my first Rebtel call last nite
Review.Contenu: I made my first Rebtel call last nite. It took me an hour to figure out how to do this, including putting "credit card" info in so that I would have "money in the account, then how you actually dial the number, recognizing a code that comes up and then finally figuring it out. The connection to the Philippines was good, there was a two second delay between us, but we learned to work with that , and I think as I use the service more, it will be much easier to use. When you are of the "ancient" variety, it's probably more challenging than for a young person !

Review.Titre: Good call quality but some big issues
Review.Contenu: Good call quality but big issuesCall quality is good but when I am calling to India, there are a few things that should be taken care of:1. When someone disconnects the call, it gets automatically redialed.2. When for some reason, like receiver's mobile is switched off or out of network, you cannot hear the default company responses but hear the normal dial tone.3. If someone has set some beautiful caller tune, you cannot hear that but just the normal dial tone.In general, whatever the situation might be, you always hear the dial tone and can't understand if something is different at receiver's end.I informed their support and according to them, they are aware of the fact and will fix it in near future. I have been their customer since 1 year but this issue seems to be as it was.

Voip tech should have advanced enough by now for things not to be as disproportionately priced. But what do i know....?

Review.Contenu: Almost everything is great. Quality of audio on both ends, functionality, convenience etc. There is one pretty big problem at least for me. When I make calls to Poland,  receivers don't see my number and mostly they say it shows "privet","unknown","restricted " number. Because of that, pretty often my calls are rejected. I've been trying to change settings in rebtel app, reinstalling and restarting my phone but no success at all. My friends complain about it as well. If you could fix this issue it would be great!!!!! 10 stars without a doubt. Greetings.

The only con, is, the line is sometimes very distorted and also the other person cannot hear with clarity. They say my voice is very feeble.

Review.Contenu: I usually have a great experience with Rebtel, however, I noticed that though I had topped up a couple days prior, and tried to make a call, the system said, "You are out of credit...top up now..." Then, it cut me off. I was disappointed. On the other hand, please notify me before dipping into my account to top up, for at times, I don't have enough in it, then Rebtel prohibits a scheduled bill to either bounce, or to create a $35.00 overdraft payment.

Review.Contenu: I have been using rebel international (France) call services for a while now, and the experience has only been good so far. Keep on it! Merci!

Review.Titre: Beware of 'special numbers'!
Review.Contenu: Pro's: good customer serviceCon's: be careful of special numbers, like 0800 numbers to the UK (which are usually free!)I needed to make a 0800 call to the UK which is a landline number, so assumed it would be charged at the standard UK rate of 2.4p/min. However, I was charged at 41p/min because it's a special number!After getting in touch with Rebtel, they explained that special numbers are not included in their usual package (either in the pay as you go or the Unlimited package). However, I was not made aware of this upfront and the detail about special numbers is buried deep in the T&Cs...Helpfully, the customer service rep (Karl Maintang) still refunded me my credit for the 'special number' call and hopefully will pass on this feedback to the product/dev team.

Review.Titre: Introduce Monthly calling rates for Kenya
Review.Contenu: I would like Rebtel to have a monthly rate for calling KENYA just like some countries in Africa. I will market them to my friends and associates who call Kenya frequently. The current call per minute is very expensive. You also charge even when the other person don't answer the phone. Thisvshould not be happening.You should introduce discounts or plans for frequent callers like me.

Review.Titre: Good service, getting more reliable
Review.Contenu: I have been using Rebtel for 3 years. I mostly use the service to call Taiwan.During most of this 3-year period, about 60% of my calls go through successfully.  During the last 2 months (Feb and March 2022), 100% of my calls go through successfully.I am happy for the improvements and I hope Rebtel will continue the good service.

Review.Titre: Works quite well
Review.Contenu: Works quite well, the app is pretty neat and can intercept international calls from the phone dialler. You can configure how you want the Rebtel app to connect (dialup, WiFi, mobile Internet) by  ticking or unticking these options. Every now and then a call doesn't connect, hence only 4 stars.If you use the link rebtel dot app dot link/wTlIFGfYfpb    you can get 8 euro credit by paying only 1 euro, which is pretty cool and will give you many hours of calls to properly try it out!

Review.Titre: First call always fails
Review.Contenu: The need for any phone service has reduced dramatically with cheap / good data connectivity everywhere and seamless messaging apps such as WhatsApp.  Even though, I use the service since it gives me the feel of “calling someone phone” and I can put Rebtel numbers in contacts / favorites.  For the last two years or more, my first call always fails and the second call immediately after works.  So this technical glitch sounds like simple but also feels a bit silly.

Review.Titre: Instant top up delivery but with an unacceptable feature
Review.Contenu: When I send top ups, it reaches almost instantly and I receive a confirmation email. The thing that I don't like is that when I send money, the app saves my credit card details. This is totally unacceptable. The app has to at least ask if we want to save the card details for easy payment in the future. I have to always go to settings and delete it every time I do some transaction. Lastly, I have seen a substantial increase on the fee when I send top ups to Ethiopia.

Review.Titre: Fair charges and accurate
Rebtel calls has been nice and clear
Review.Contenu: Rebtel calls has been nice and clear. The only problem is that the minutes always run fast before you know it your call balance is finished. Also Rebtel has to be giving bonus call credit to main customers that uses their app to make calls every time. This will help to increase the rate that the customers use to make calls.

Review.Titre: Be aware of credit expiry if accounts are inactive for long periods of time
Review.Contenu: I don't use rebel much so had plenty of balance left idle for a while and then all of a sudden all my balance us gone. No communication from Rebtel at all. Do not trust this service with your money.Edit: since contacting support I had a quick and speedy refund for my credit and an explanation that the credit had been removed due to account inactivity. Re-rated to 4star (would have been 5 if it was made clearer that this would happen, and perhaps a warning reminder to users that credit was at risk due to account inactivity). Thanks.

Review.Titre: Easy to use
Review.Contenu: It's a great app, easy to use and to top up. According to the number/place you are calling it shows minutes of call availability. I AM A SERVANT OF THE POOR , CARING FOR THE VOLNURABLE ON THE STREETS. PLEASE IF YOU COULD GIVE ME AT A CHEAPER RATE, THAT WILL BE OK FOR ME. THANKS AND GOD BLESS YOU.REV. SR MARYCHIDALU.

Overall, Rebtel has been fantastic.  Thank you.
